reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely old hotel, with very high ceilings. Very comfortable with balcony and lake views. I would definitely recommend and stay again. The views and gardens are spectacular. Great heated pool and very helpful staff.
reviews.title: Grand old hotel on the lake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great surprise to stay here. Previous reviews were mixed. We had a great room, crisp and clean with great bed. The bathroom of mirrors was interesting. We had a balcony which look directly over Lake Geneva with only a walkway in front of the hotel. It is a bit of a walk from the train station, but not a problem. There is also taxis and buses handy. It would be great if they had Wi-fi in rooms and not just foyer, but other than that absolutely love our stay there.
reviews.title: Wonderful place and position

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was rebooked at this hotel when my original room at the Hotel Eden Palace could not be provided. The Excelsior is a little further away than most hotels but was worth the extra walk. The Lake View rooms have amazing views. The hotel has an 18th century flair with high ceilings and ornate architecture. The bathroom was spacious and completed updated while the room itself retained the original parkay floors and French doors to the balcony.
reviews.title: Grand Hotel with spectacular views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: More like a hospital than a hotel, this place is bizarre and unsettling. It is unwelcoming, understaffed and gives the feeling of being on a horror film set before the actors have arrived. Most guests are sick and do not leave their rooms except to deposit room service washing up. What few staff we encountered were unhelpful and more like guards. All hotels in Montreux are expensive, but at about £400 per night without breakfast, I would prefer to sleep in the car. Only saving grace is a stunning view.
reviews.title: UNDERWHELMING AND DISTURBING

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here at the beginning of July. Really liked our room and particularly loved the amazing views. We had a very noisy family next door and if we had been staying longer than two nights, we would have asked to change rooms. Breakfast was good with the usual items although we did eat in our room one night and the food was not wonderful but maybe we made poor choices. We used the swimming pool mid day and found only ourselves in it which was great. Montreux itself is a beautiful spot and I would recommend a visit. We travelled by train from Geneva (around an hour). Take a taxi to the hotel (about ten mins).
reviews.title: Amazing Views

reviews.title: Good and not so good.

reviews.text: The hotel is in a very good position with rooms having fantastic views of the lake and mountains, and a flower filled promenade between the hotel and lake. An easy walk to the centre of Montreux, yet in a quiet, peaceful area. There is also easy access to the bus stop and buses every ten minutes to anywhere along the Montreux Riviera. Better still, these are free with the Montreux card. From reading our guide book, we expected to be given the cards on arrival, but we had to ask for them, then were given them without the book which went with them. We helped ourselves to one from the reception desk the following day. Following advice from other reviews, on being given the room key, I asked if we were in one of the refurbished rooms. The reply was, you are in a standard room on the second floor and it is very nice. The room and bathroom were large, with a small balcony. However, the carpet was faded, the mattress was very soft and their was no headboard and no valance. The outside of the balcony door was badly in need of a coat of paint. This is not quite what we would expect from a four star hotel. After two nights of trying to sleep on the very soft mattress my back was extremely painful. We asked if we could have a firmer mattress and were told all the mattresses were the same. The housekeeper was very helpful and put boards under the mattress, this did not help, so she found a firm thin mattress and put the boards on top of the soft mattress, then the firm mattress on top. Thankfully, with that and painkillers the problem was solved.
reviews.title: Wonderful and Romantic Hotel
